credentialType.description: Credential type to identify the application that uses the credential
Credential type to identify the application that uses the credential

authPassword.description: AuthPassword is required if SNMP mode is AuthPriv / AuthNoPriv

credentialType.description: Credential type to identify the application that uses the credential

authType.description: Authentication type is required if SNMP mode is AuthPriv / AuthNoPriv

privacyPassword.description: Privacy password is required if SNMP mode is AuthPriv

privacyType.description: Privacy type is required if SNMP mode is AuthPriv

credentialType.description: Credential type to identify the application that uses the credential
Credential type to identify the application that uses the credential

operations.notes: This method is used to get global credential for the given credential sub type
operations.summary: Retrieves global credential for the given credential sub type

parameters.description: Credential type as CLI / SNMPV2_READ_COMMUNITY / SNMPV2_WRITE_COMMUNITY / SNMPV3
parameters.name: credentialSubType

responseMessages.message: The request was successful, however no content was returned.
The target resource is in a conflicted state (for example, an edit conflict where a resource is being edited by multiple users). Retrying the request later might succeed.
The GET request included a Range Header, and the server responded with the partial content matching the range.
The server did not respond inside time restrictions and timed-out.
The client sent a request body in a format that the server does not support (for example, XML to a server that only accepts JSON).
The request was successful. The result is contained in the response body.
The server could not fulfill the request.
The server has not implemented the functionality required to fulfill the request.
The server recognizes the authentication credentials, but the client is not authorized to perform this request.
The client made a request that the server could not understand (for example, the request syntax is incorrect).
The server is (temporarily) unavailable.
The client's authentication credentials included with the request are missing or invalid.
The client made a request for a resource that does not exist.

responseMessages.message: The request was successful, however no content was returned.
The target resource is in a conflicted state (for example, an edit conflict where a resource is being edited by multiple users). Retrying the request later might succeed.

The POST/PUT request was fulfilled and a new resource has been created. Information about the resource is in the response body.

The client sent a request body in a format that the server does not support (for example, XML to a server that only accepts JSON).
